body: Some fighters focus their efforts on finding the biggest, heaviest, most imposing weapon they can find and training to manage and harness the weight of their massive weapons for maximum impact. These fighting school benefits only apply when using two-handed weapons.
name: Two-Handed Fighter
url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Fighter/Fighter Archetypes/Two-Handed Fighter

sections.body: At 2nd level, a two-handed fighter gains a +1 bonus to CMB and CMD on sunder attempts and on damage rolls made against objects. These bonuses increase by +1 for every four levels beyond 2nd. This ability replaces bravery.
sections.name: Shattering Strike
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Fighter/Fighter Archetypes/Two-Handed Fighter/Shattering Strike

sections.body: At 3rd level, when a two-handed fighter makes a single attack (with the attack action or a charge) with a two-handed weapon, he adds double his Strength bonus on damage rolls. This ability replaces armor training 1.
sections.name: Overhand Chop
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Fighter/Fighter Archetypes/Two-Handed Fighter/Overhand Chop

sections.body: As the fighter class feature, but the bonuses only apply when wielding two-handed melee weapons.
sections.name: Weapon Training
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Fighter/Fighter Archetypes/Two-Handed Fighter/Weapon Training

sections.body: At 7th level, when a two-handed fighter makes a full attack with a two-handed weapon, he adds double his Strength bonus on damage rolls for all attacks after the first. This ability replaces armor training 2.
sections.name: Backswing
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Fighter/Fighter Archetypes/Two-Handed Fighter/Backswing

sections.body: At 11th level, as a standard action, a two-handed fighter can make a single melee attack with a two-handed weapon. If the attack hits, he may make a bull rush or trip combat maneuver against the target of his attack as a free action that does not provoke an attack of opportunity. This ability replaces armor training 3.
sections.name: Piledriver
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Fighter/Fighter Archetypes/Two-Handed Fighter/Piledriver

sections.body: At 15th level, when using Power Attack with a two-handed melee weapon, the bonus damage from Power Attack is doubled (+100%) instead of increased by half (+50%). This ability replaces armor training 4.
sections.name: Greater Power Attack
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Fighter/Fighter Archetypes/Two-Handed Fighter/Greater Power Attack

sections.body: At 19th level, as a standard action, a two-handed fighter may make a single melee attack with a two-handed weapon at a –5 penalty. If the attack hits, it is treated as a critical threat. Special weapon abilities that activate only on a critical hit do not activate if this critical hit is confirmed. This ability replaces armor mastery.
sections.name: Devastating Blow
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Fighter/Fighter Archetypes/Two-Handed Fighter/Devastating Blow
